details:
Several vulnerabilities were fixed in JRuby, a Java implementation of
the Ruby programming language.


* [CVE-2017-17742](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-17742)
[CVE-2019-16254](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-16254)
HTTP Response Splitting attacks in the HTTP server of WEBrick.
* [CVE-2019-16201](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-16201)
Regular Expression Denial of Service vulnerability of WEBrick's Digest access authentication.
* [CVE-2019-16255](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-16255)
Code injection vulnerability.
* [CVE-2020-25613](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-25613)
HTTP Request Smuggling attack in WEBrick.
* [CVE-2021-31810](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-31810)
Trusting FTP PASV responses vulnerability in Net::FTP.
* [CVE-2021-32066](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-32066)
Net::IMAP did not raise an exception when StartTLS fails with an an unknown response.
* [CVE-2023-28755](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-28755)
Quadratic backtracking on invalid URI.
* [CVE-2023-28756](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2023-28756)
The Time parser mishandled invalid strings that have specific characters.


For Debian 10 buster, these problems have been fixed in version
9.1.17.0-3+deb10u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your jruby packages.


For the detailed security status of jruby please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/jruby>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
